lender.name: Jennifer L. Pozner
lender.loan_because: Women and girls and the majority of the world's poor, and KIVA's microloans provide one of many ways to combat this economic injustice (as well as to fight poverty and hunger for all).
lender.occupational_info:
I am a journalist, media critic and public speaker whose work has focused on improving representations of women, people of color, and human rights issues in the media. I lecture on gender, race and class in the media at high schools and colleges in the U.s. And Canada, and do freelance writing for print and online newspapers, magazines and blogs.
I founded Women In Media & News, a small non-profit organization whose mission is to monitor images of women's and other social justice issues in news and entertainment media; train women's rights and social justice activists to get their stories heard; to help journalists amplify the quantity and diversity of women's voices in news and public debate; and to advocate public interest standards in media policies. Additionally, I wrote the book, "Reality Bites Back: The Troubling Truth About Guilty Pleasure TV."

lender.name: Sensor
lender.occupational_info: As one of the many leading brands under Acuity, Sensor Switch, Inc. has established itself since its founding in 1987 among the world’s leading providers in the latest lighting control technologies. Its motto: “to provide cost-effective lighting controls for maximum return on investment” has long anchored it in its being a highly respected leader in lighting technologies. Thus it also maintains a reputation as a provider of energy-saving lighting solutions alongside return on investment (ROI). Sensor Switch’s extensive association of itself in the development of products oriented towards energy efficiency and suitability has resulted in the largest selection in occupancy sensors and photocell devices custom-built to accommodate different forms of industries. This in turn assures of Sensor Switch’s providing of its lighting control solutions to be used in any form and/or function. Sensor Switch, Inc. is dedicated to its constant endeavor in the latest in innovative lighting technology solutions. These products are the result of its highly-gifted and varied engineer teams who know no bounds in developing newer and better lighting solutions for the client. These technologies also adopt sustainable lighting features which make for a more wholesome and efficient lifestyle among both its clients and employees.

lender.occupation: Buy Protect a Bed to prevent bed bugs
lender.occupational_info: Protect-A-Bed mattress covers are an innovation no bed should be without. A typical mattress pad does nothing for allergy relief, health and hygiene or protecting your mattress from incontinence. Protect-A-Bed® products do. A Protect-A-Bed® mattress protector provides an ultra-thin, impermeable layer of protection between you and your mattress while offering comfort and better rest. Protect-A-Bed® mattress protectors come in a variety of sizes to fit any bed – from cribs to California King mattresses.

lender.name: jason
lender.occupational_info: LED lighting is fast becoming one of the most popular lighting solutions available on the market today. LED lights feature many advantages, including significant energy saving capabilities. Compared to traditional lighting, LED lights use up a lot less energy and burn brighter. In fact, they are the first choice for lighting when it comes to sustainable building designs or green lighting, primarily because they require far less energy than traditional lighting products, thereby saving on resources.

lender.name: Mike and Shannon
lender.loan_because:
A man goes out on the beach and sees that it is covered with starfish that have washed up in the tide. A little boy is walking along, picking them up and throwing them back into the water.
“What are you doing son?” the man asks. “You see how many starfish there are? You’ll never make a difference.”
The boy paused thoughtfully, and picked up another starfish and threw it into the ocean.
“It sure made a difference to that one,” he said.
-- "Half the Sky" pg 45
